refnamediv.refpurpose: Efficiently evaluates a polynomial of arbitrary order.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The polynomial opcode calculates a polynomial with a single a-rate input variable. The polynomial is a sum of any number of terms in the form kn*x^n where kn is the nth coefficient of the expression. These coefficients are k-rate values.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: aout polynomial ain, k0 [, k1 [, k2 [...]]]

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: ain -- the input signal used as the independent variable of the polynomial ("x").
k0, k1, k2, ... -- the coefficients for each term of the polynomial.

If we consider the input parameter ain to be "x" and the output aout to be "y", then the polynomial opcode calculates the following equation:
y = k0 + k1*x + k2*x^2 + k3*x^3 + ...
